description: Toronto Adventures mission is to bring outdoor recreation to your doorstep. We offer City Kayaking, Canoeing and SUP.

reviews.title: A beautiful and different perspective of Toronto!
text: Kayaking on the Humber River was fantastic - an entirely different way to experience Toronto. The staff was helpful and patient. My cousin who's lived in Toronto for decades now wants to do it!

reviews.title: Great Experience
text: Had a great time exploring the humber river! The scenery was gorgeous, lots of wildlife and the price was excellent for 2 hours. Staff was also super friendly!

reviews.title: Loved the Yoga and paddle board
text: Had an amazing morning yoga and paddle.  Thanks Bo for an excellent class.  Highly recommend this duo experience.  I will be back!

reviews.title: Saved my day!
text: We always love using Toronto Adventures! My annoying blow-up kayak failed me and these guys came to the rescue with a sweet tandem kayak for me to rent.
Touring the Humber is such a step outside of city life. Always tons of animals and birds to enjoy.

reviews.title: Great summer activity in Toronto!
text: It's a great oasis in the middle of the city. Helpful staff, a fun few hours paddling. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fun summer activity.

reviews.title: Paddle one, paddle all!
text: As a client of over 14 years, I'm beyond happy to recommend this family-owned business. The staff are helpful, service fantastic and the stretch of the Humber is just long enough for novices and experienced paddlers alike. But what makes TO Adventures different you ask? First, reasonable prices, secondly "extras" like music, comedy and night paddling events for starters. Rosaire and co. go the extra mile to ensure a safe, enjoyable experience! Finally, throw in an abundance of birds and wildlife in their own habitat and the experience is complete. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great canoeing on the Humber with Toronto Adventures
text: I had two great experiences at Toronto Adventures. For being in the middle of the city, the views along the Humber river for beautiful. The staff was also very helpful, friendly and prepared us well at the beginning of the adventure.

reviews.title: Amazing, relaxing experience near the Old Mill in Toronto.
text: I have been kayaking with Toronto Adventures numerous times.  The staff are friendly, helpful and organized.  It is great being on the Humber River; the sites are amazing.  If you're unsure, you can take a private lesson first to give you confidence.

reviews.title: Recommended
text: Iwas a walk in  on a busy weekend but they had me and my son on the water in a canoe in minutes for $80. Friendly staff. Great way to fill half a day.

reviews.title: Splendid Time on the Humber
text: We had a wonderful kayaking experience - warm and sunny weather, comfortable gear and very helpful staff.  Will do another session before the end of summer!

reviews.title: 2 great days out
text: In January 2018 I went for a dog sledding trip, and a couple days later a snowshoeing trip.

The dog sledding trip was great fun, and really something different to try out. I found the dogs to be enthusiastic and friendly. Yes if you are expecting them to all be like house dogs curled up on the sofa it would be a bit of a shock, but they are not, and they seemed totally fine. It's a great trip to get to know other travellers as there is a little fire with seats so you can warm up, get some s'mores and chat with others.

However, if you want a real winter experience I HIGHLY recommend taking a snowshoeing trip. Where the dog sledding itself is over quite quickly, snowshoeing is a good 3-4 hours of walking through the woods, over small frozen rivers, occasionally seeing other people out in the forest, looking out for tracks of different animals and learning how to build a fire (even in a snowy forest!) Definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Toronto, and the guys running the business are very friendly and great to chat to, with one of them even going to the university in the city over from my tiny little uk city so plenty to chat about! I will definitely be suggesting to one of my friends at work who is visiting toronto in summer to check this company out c: Overall, a great time at both events.

reviews.title: Great Tour Operator
text: Well run Summer and Winter tours
Been to their Dog sledding tours
Did not see any " cruelty "
Current hooplah seems to have originated from a Facebook post .Social media sometimes makes you "  guilty till proven innocent "
Been their customer 3 times - 2015 for Kayaking in summer and 2015/ 2016 for Dog sledding.
DID NOT see any dog cruelty ( once you get regulatory agencies involved usually they go overboard with all kinds of things they find )
This tour operator has nothing to do with the dog sledding hooplah in Barrie
They organize wonderful tours for all to enjoy outdoors in ALL kinds of weather

reviews.title: Horrible and Inhumane living conditions for the dogs
text: Upon our arrival to the dog sledding adventures, we were told while waiting to go check out the dogs.  To the left was a small area with around 12-15 dogs that we were excited to see and interact with.  Most of them seemed happy enough with the exception of a few that seemed hesitant and even some that refused to come out of their poorly constructed barrel huts.  We sat for 10 minutes with one dog encouraging it to come out, but it was shaking and was not very trusting. As we stood up to go back to our group we noticed a whole other section of dogs through a pathway further along the trail and we decided to go check it out.  We thought there were only 5 more dogs, but as we approached closer and the longer we stayed the more dogs came out from their huts and we quickly realized there were at least 50 more dogs.  The second dog we approached was inside her hut and had a large gash in her right eye that was full of dry blood and she could barely keep it open.  The sight of this dog and other dogs who could barely even walk brought both of us to tears.  Not one dog looked happy to be there. You could actually see the sadness in their eyes.  Each dog wore a heavy collar that was much too tight and chained to an object in the center of their tiny enclosure with many dog's chains bound up where they couldn't even move.  The only place they could go to the washroom was right where they stood.  There was poop and urine all over their circle and under their feet.  After speaking with the owner we learned that the dogs stay here day and night even in the freezing cold weather conditions some of the mixed breeds cleary could not withstand as they were shaking. We noticed that none of the dogs had water, which we realized was because it was so cold it would just freeze, but we worried that these dogs were not being properly fed or hydrated, especially with the fact that they are being forced to pull people on sleds,  We no longer felt comfortable supporting what was happening as we had this ongoing feeling of helplessness and guilt for the conditions these dogs have to live in.  It just doesn't seem right and we hope something is done about it, and that others who visit have the same compassion and thoughts as we did.  No animal should have to live like that.

reviews.title: It's like leaving the city but you are still a walk to the subway
text: I rented a Kayak to go down the Humber river there for the first time at the end of August.  Since my first time, I've gone another 4 times.  Its beautiful.  You really feel like you've left the city even though you are so close to the subway.   The staff is great and very knowledgeable and helpful.  They will help you launch your kayak and help you back up the embankment.   Book online in advance as you are not guaranteed a boat if you just walk up and try to pay for it on the spot.   The prices are cheaper during the weekdays and if you get a membership you receive a 25% discount.

reviews.title: Great activity on the Humber R
text: A sunny warm day meandering down the Humber R in a single or double kayak - what a great way to spent a lazy afternoon in Toronto! Professional, always helpful and smiling, the staff outfit you, offer a quick basic lesson if you need it, and off you go. We saw egret, mergansers, a diving osprey, beautiful marshes. A great west-end Toronto activity.

reviews.title: Humber river at its best!
text: Wish we found this sooner! We did not know that we had such accessible and affordable kayaking/canoeing right in the heart of the city. We've been kayaking in many of the cities we've visited but not really in our own hometown.

The humber river here is very peaceful and easy to navigate.There were so many different types of birds along the route. We even saw a turtle and a deer. We saw the most when we went into the lagoon conversation area.
The staff were friendly and helpful. What a perfect way to spend a weekend morning.

reviews.title: Great Kayaking experience
text: I've kayaked a couple of times at Humber river. The last time we did a two-hour kayaking with friends, we got the deal on Groupon. It is very relaxing and the scenery is beautiful. Good staff with good service.

reviews.title: Don't bother getting the lesson & guide tour, kayaking solo is best bet
text: I took my son to kayak on the Humber River and we paid an extra $20 plus tax to get a guided tour each (we had solo kayaks). The lesson consists of a 3 min blur on how to hold your paddle. We were 5 kayaks and one canoe (with mother and two kids). The kayaking is for beginners. I've only ever kayaked twice in the carribean, so I"m a beginner, but am able to paddle and hold my own of course. So it started off late, we got in the water about 15 min later than expected. So I thought we were going to get a guided tour and a talk about the area etc. and the guide was only helping the canoe people. So we paddled a little fully expecting that this guide would give a briefing and then lead the group. Didn't happen. He sayed with them the whole time. 15 min in I asked the guide it we were going to get a tour, he said yes, but that he had to go at the pace of the slowest person...? I said, well how does that benefit the whole group then? Canoeing from what I hear is very different too, so why merge the two? So I said, that wasn't good enough and that we would go on our own, but that I wanted a refund for the tour part. He said we could work something out when we got back to the registration desk. Kayaking was good. It's about an hour to get to the QEW, and an hour back. They include 2 hours. We got back well within the time. We got to the registration desk and they gave us a cash refund, but of only $20 each. I was out $5. Anyway, good expereince, but don't bother with the lesson and tour. NOTE: they have free parking.

reviews.title: A great afternoon canoeing on the Humber River!
text: We did a two-hour canoeing excursion with Toronto Adventures as a birthday treat and had a great time!

We've kayaked and canoed a lot, so we didn't need any instruction but paddling lessons are available for beginners.  There are also guided paddles of the Humber available.  (We did a guided kayak tour last fall which was a lot of fun and is highly recommended!)

The directions to the Humber River canoe site on the web site are clear and easy to follow, and the location is very easy to find, being under the Old Mill TTC subway station.  Registration was pretty straightforward, and after signing the release forms we got fitted with our PFDs and paddles, were helped into our canoe, and were on our way.
We spent a lovely two hours on the river, and will definitely use Toronto Adventures again!

reviews.title: Awesome Experience!
text: Spent the afternoon dog-sledding and snowshoeing around the property. The highlight was being able to interact with all the dogs (and puppies) on-site (most of them are super affectionate and friendly). Everything was fairly organized and the staff were awesome and helpful. A (very light) lunch and some snacks were provided.
We did the drive yourself option (so that we could leave at our leisure), but if you take the transportation they offer, it is via a school bus.

reviews.title: Friendly staff
text: Nice little piece of nature in the city. Make sure you check out the marshes. I would go early if you can. The staff were very friendly and helpful!

reviews.title: A nature escape inside the city!
text: We recently booked two tandem kayaks for the Humber River. We are relatively experienced at kayaking, so the fairly sparse pre-trip instructions were fine for us. And we appreciated the cleaning/drying out of one kayak's storage nook before our trip. I can't say as that we saw any staff out on the river during our 2-hour rental. For us, that wasn't a problem, but there were definitely customers who were not experienced and may have needed guidance. But it's a beautiful location (so many migratory birds to see) and such an easy river to navigate in both directions because there is virtually no current. The pricing is a bit high, but I guess for tourists who can't bring their own kayaks, that's the price that the market will bear.

reviews.title: Peaceful but disappointed
text: I'll start off by mentioning I have paddled the Humber once before in a canoe with one of the Toronto Adventures guides a few yrs back - that was a great experience.  This time there were 6 of us who went out in 3 tandem kayaks - 3 adults, 3 kids (12-15).  During the course of the brief orientation, there was another employee sitting in the canopy behind him talking in a loud voice the entire time making it difficult  to hear him clearly.  At the time I thought "hmm, bit unprofessional" but managed to hear what he was saying.

When we set off none of us were made aware that the middle of the river was so shallow for the first leg of the journey.  Only a few minutes out, our kayak  grounded in the middle of the river on a rocky sandbank.  I was forced to get out of the kayak, standing in very cold water above my knees and move us off the river bed.  Unfortunately, when I went to get back in the kayak it capsized and we were wet up to our chests and left with a water-logged vessel.

Incredibly, there was no one from the company standing on the disembarkation point which was only about  50 m away.  We managed to get some of the water out of the boat but it was still 1/2 full. Because the kayak was so full of water,  I waited in the river while my companion paddled back to the bank in the hopes of getting a new, dry kayak.

Eventually she was able to find an employee but instead of providing her w/ a new boat, they told her that someone would come out to help us.  I waited another 10 mins at least before someone showed up and then I had to ask him if he worked for the Toronto Adventures since he never actually came up and said "do you need some help."  WTF - I'm standing alone in the middle of the river up to my crotch in cold water at this point.

The T.A. employee  told me to get back in the water-logged kayak and paddle back to shore where they would get us a new boat.     I'm  not sure why they didn't just do that when my companion went back the 1st time.

Needless to say we were both soaked through and my cell phone was toast.  When I mentioned what had happened to the staff, all they could say was "didn't you hear us tell you not to paddle in the middle of the river when you left, we always tell people that?"  Well, apparently not every time.   BTW, I asked my fellow kayakers after, if they had heard them warn us  to avoid the middle of the river and ALL  of them said "no, they never mentioned that."   Not even the young man who pushed us off to begin with.

Yes, I was the clumsy one who tipped the kayak getting back in,  but it wouldn't have been necessary for me  to get out of the damn boat in the first place if someone had of told us to avoid that section of the river.   NO ONE told us about the shallow water
We did eventually end up doing our paddle (albeit somewhat shortened and in wet clothes).   For what it's worth,  it was lovely and peaceful  along the river - hence the 3 star rating.

I will say that  despite the presence of at least 4 or 5 Toronto Adventure employees, there didn't seem to be anyone around when my companion went back.  You would think that they might keep a watch out on the bank for people or anyone who might be struggling.   There was someone when we came back in to pull our kayak back up on shore.

I should also point out that I am an experienced kayaker and boater having summered at a family cottage all my life and having operated all sorts of different water craft.  Heck, I even have my own kayak up north.  Our experience was unfortunate but I want to point out that  at no time were we in any danger, just uncomfortable and very let down by the lack of response from the staff.  And of course, out the  replacement cost  of my cell phone.

I do worry though that others who aren't as comfortable with water as am I,  would have found this type of experience a bit more harrowing.   Once the employees launch you, there doesn't seem to be anyone around to mind the shop and you're  kind of left on your own.

reviews.title: Great Way to spend a couple hours
text: A friend and I rented a kayak for the first time in July. I enjoyed it so much that I went back....again and again. It’s a very relaxing way to spend a morning, if you enjoy nature and being on the water.
The Frequent Paddlers Pass is great value!
The staff on site are outstanding, they are very knowledgeable, personable and hardworking.

I would definitely recommend. In fact, since my first visit, I have taken my friend and her two sons. This week they’ll be joining me, as well as three other friends who’ll be enjoying it for the first time.

reviews.title: Adventure Within Your City
text: Amazing fun time kayaking on the Humber River for the 5th time. Life jackets and kayaks are supplied. Book the rental online and just show up. I purchased the frequent paddler discount pass that gives you 30% off rentals and events.  The waters on the Humber River are calm and you can see wild life such as swans, geese, ducks.

reviews.title: Great guided canoe trip!
text: We had so much fun on this trip! Our guide was great :)  We paddled through marshes and out into Lake Ontario and saw lots of wildlife.

reviews.title: Great experience: Perfect for a date.
text: Enjoy rowing in the Humber River with your sweetheart, maybe you can even get to the Lake with a great memory.
It is an opportunity to enjoy an express retreat within the city, discovering hidden spots and observing nature.
Staff is very kind and professional.
Highly recommended, go and try!
It is at walking distance from Old Mill Subway station.

reviews.title: Great Escape in the City!
text: I rented a canoe but had accidentally rented it on the wrong day. Although it was extremely busy, Gabriel went out of his way and managed to re-work my booking. The staff went above and beyond and the scenery was lovely! Highly recommend for anyone looking to escape the hustle and bustle for a few hours.

reviews.title: Great customer service
text: The people who work at Toronto Adventures were amazing in accommodating our large party. A great thing to do with family visiting from out of town. Patty especially was so helpful over the phone and then promptly emailed me back with all of the information I needed. Thank you!

reviews.title: Beautiful dogs that love what they do!
text: The dogs are all well taken care of and are very happy and healthy. We had so much fun dog sledding and saw the love, knowledge and care that came from the people running the expedition.
The dogs were all very well socialized, were very friendly and loved the attention. The organizers did a great job at swapping out dogs in each sled team when they got tired.
The day we went it was extremely cold so make sure you dress warmly!! The dog sledding is a sport so it does help keep you warm!

reviews.title: Great adventure!
text: This was a great experience from start to finish. Staff was terrific, organized, efficient, and great to deal with. Highly recommend going!

reviews.title: Just amazing!
text: Amazing service! I use the Toronto Adventures whenever I need a break from the busy city; and the rives is very scenic, my cat also enjoyed it!

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: Best city get away you can get at a very reasonable price . Befautiful location, like a mini holiday. Super well organized with helpful staf.f..

reviews.title: Lazy Relaxing and Scenic
text: Had a great paddle with my granddaughter. Staff was ready for us on arrival and gave helpful instructions and assistance when launching and returning.

reviews.title: Great way to spend an afternoon!
text: I've been using Toronto Adventures for several yeas now because it's such a nice option to have in the city! You don't need a car or kayak, just register and show up! They have everything you need. Be sure to bring water, sunscreen and some treats though!

reviews.title: always a fun time
text: Always a great time, fast to check in and get into the water. 2 hours is more than enough time to get from the starting point, to the bridge and back and the route is very scenic with calm water

reviews.title: Very well organized trip
text: Wonderful experience, well trained staff and very helpful. Special thanks to Mady for being our guide

reviews.title: A fantastic way to spend a morning in the great outdoors
text: This is honestly one of the most fun, wonderful ways to spend 2 hours with your family!!! Each time we have gone kayaking we have seen different wildlife and had a different experience! The staff is also super nice and helpful! I cannot say enough good things about Toronto Adventures!

reviews.title: Amazing views in Toronto.
text: The staff were informative as well as helpful.  If you are in the Toronto area, you need to grab a kayak, boat etc...and see the amazing sites.

reviews.title: Good experience with Toronto Adventures
text: Thank you for your guidance before we went for our canoe and kayak trip on the Humber. Your patience and explanation was most helpful. All the staff were great!
